intro: Monogynella timorensis, commonly known as the Timor senna, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in open, sunny habitats. It is known for its ability to fix nitrogen through symbiotic relationships with rhizobia bacteria in its root nodules. Monogynella timorensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
